Variables

int qiap_errno
 

Error values

Note
Error values in the range -900..-999 are reserved for use by layers built on top of the CODA library.
#define QIAP_SUCCESS   (0)
 
#define QIAP_ERROR_OUT_OF_MEMORY   (-1)
 
#define QIAP_ERROR_CODA   (-10)
 
#define QIAP_ERROR_XML   (-11)
 
#define QIAP_ERROR_SERVER   (-20)
 
#define QIAP_ERROR_FILE_NOT_FOUND   (-30)
 
#define QIAP_ERROR_FILE_OPEN   (-31)
 
#define QIAP_ERROR_FILE_READ   (-32)
 
#define QIAP_ERROR_FILE_WRITE   (-33)
 
#define QIAP_ERROR_INVALID_ARGUMENT   (-40)
 
#define QIAP_ERROR_DISCARD   (-50)
 

Detailed Description

The QIAP interface consists of functions to query, read, manipulate and write Quality Issue Reports. The interface provides transparent data structures for all data types, which means that you can access the contents of these data structures directly. It is however strongly recommended to only access the data structures directly for reading purposes. For creating, modifying, and deleting the structures use the interface functions that are provided by the QIAP interface.

Macro Definition Documentation

#define QIAP_ERROR_CODA   (-10)

An error occurred in the CODA library.

#define QIAP_ERROR_DISCARD   (-50)

An applicable QIAP action determined that the product or parameter needs to be discarded.

#define QIAP_ERROR_FILE_NOT_FOUND   (-30)

File not found.

#define QIAP_ERROR_FILE_OPEN   (-31)

Could not open file.

#define QIAP_ERROR_FILE_READ   (-32)

Could not read data from file.

#define QIAP_ERROR_FILE_WRITE   (-33)

Could not write data to file.

#define QIAP_ERROR_INVALID_ARGUMENT   (-40)

Invalid argument.

#define QIAP_ERROR_OUT_OF_MEMORY   (-1)

Out of memory.

#define QIAP_ERROR_SERVER   (-20)

An error occurred while trying to connect with the QIAP server.

#define QIAP_ERROR_XML   (-11)

An error occurred while parsing an XML data block.

#define QIAP_SUCCESS   (0)

Success (no error).

Typedef Documentation

qiap_action

QIAP Action

Contains the action that should be performed to the whole product or a specific product parameter.

qiap_action_type

QIAP Action Type Contains the type of action to be performed (e.g. discard or correct data)

qiap_affected_product

QIAP Affected Product

Details on a specific affected product. Covers information on the extent, any affected values and applicable actions.

qiap_affected_value

QIAP Affected Value

Details on a specific affected parameter in a product. Covers information on the extent and any applicable actions.

qiap_algorithm

QIAP Algorithm

Details on the custom action that needs to be performed on a product or product parameter.

qiap_quality_issue

QIAP Quality Issue

Full information regarding a quality issue, including any affected product/values and associated actions.

qiap_quality_issue_report

QIAP Quality Issue Report

A collection of Quality Issues coming from a single data provider.

qiap_query

QIAP Query

Contains the query parameters with which to request a Quality Issue Report from a QIAP server.

Function Documentation

void qiap_action_delete ( qiap_action *  action)

Remove a QIAP Action data structure Free any memory allocated for this data structure and its contents. This function will also call qiap_algorithm_delete() if a QIAP Algorithm was set.

Parameters
actionQIAP Action data structure that should be removed.
qiap_action* qiap_action_new ( const char *  last_modification_date,
qiap_action_type  action_type 
)

Returns a new QIAP Action data structure.

Parameters
last_modification_dateLast modification date of the information regarding the action (in ISO format)
action_typeThe type of action that is to be performed.
Returns
Pointer to a newly allocated and initialised QIAP Action data structure.
int qiap_action_set_algorithm ( qiap_action *  action,
qiap_algorithm *  algorithm 
)

Set the algorithm for a QIAP Action. This function should only be called for actions of type qiap_action_custom.

Parameters
actionQIAP Action.
algorithmPointer to a QIAP algorithm data structure.
Returns
  • 0, Success.
  • -1, Error occurred (check qiap_errno).
int qiap_action_set_correction ( qiap_action *  action,
const char *  correction 
)

Set the corrective action for a QIAP Action. This function should only be called for actions of type qiap_action_correct_value.

Parameters
actionQIAP Action.
correctionString containing a correction expression (see QIAP standard for details).
Returns
  • 0, Success.
  • -1, Error occurred (check qiap_errno).
int qiap_action_set_order ( qiap_action *  action,
long  order 
)

Set the priority order of the QIAP Action.

Parameters
actionQIAP Action.
orderInteger value giving the priority order with which to apply the action. Higher values have higher precedence.
Returns
  • 0, Success.
  • -1, Error occurred (check qiap_errno).

qiap_action *  action 
)

int qiap_affected_product_add_product ( qiap_affected_product *  affected_product,
const char *  product 
)

Add a specific affected product for a QIAP Affected Product. You should either call this function or qiap_affected_product_set_extent() to define the extent, but not both.

Parameters
affected_productQIAP Affected Product.
productString containing the filename of the product that is affected.
Returns
  • 0, Success.
  • -1, Error occurred (check qiap_errno).
void qiap_affected_product_delete ( qiap_affected_product *  affected_product)

Remove a QIAP Affected Product data structure Free any memory allocated for this data structure and its contents. This function will also call qiap_action_delete() for each QIAP Action that was set and call qiap_affected_value_delete() for each QIAP Affected Value that was set.

Parameters
affected_productQIAP Affected Product data structure that should be removed.
qiap_affected_product* qiap_affected_product_new ( long  affected_product_id,
const char *  product_type 
)

Returns a new QIAP Affected Product data structure.

Parameters
affected_product_idNumeric identifier of the affected product.
product_typeString containing the name of the product type for this set of affected products.
Returns
Pointer to a newly allocated and initialised QIAP Affected Product data structure.
int qiap_affected_product_set_extent ( qiap_affected_product *  affected_product,
const char *  extent 
)

Set the extent for a QIAP Affected Product. You should either call this function or qiap_affected_product_add_product() to define the extent, but not both.

Parameters
affected_productQIAP Affected Product.
extentString containing an extent expression (see QIAP standard for details).
Returns
  • 0, Success.
  • -1, Error occurred (check qiap_errno).

const char *  parameter_value_path

Parameters
affected_valueQIAP Affected Value.
parameter_value_pathString containing a local path within a product that is affected by the issue.
Returns
  • 0, Success.
  • -1, Error occurred (check qiap_errno).

Remove a QIAP Affected Value data structure Free any memory allocated for this data structure and its contents. This function will also call qiap_action_delete() for each QIAP Action that was set.

Parameters

Pointer to a newly allocated and initialised QIAP Algorithm data structure.
const char* qiap_errno_to_string ( int  err)

Returns a string with the description of the QIAP error. If err equals the current QIAP error status then this function will return the error message that was last set using qiap_set_error(). If the error message argument to qiap_set_error() was NULL or if err does not equal the current QIAP error status then the default error message for err will be returned.

Parameters
errValue of qiap_errno.
Returns
String with a description of the QIAP error.
const char* qiap_get_action_type_name ( qiap_action_type  action_type)

Returns a string with the name of the QIAP action type. Will be either 'discard product', 'discard value', 'correct value', or 'custom correction'.

Parameters
action_typeQIAP action type.
Returns
String with the name of the action type.

void qiap_quality_issue_delete ( qiap_quality_issue *  quality_issue)

Remove a QIAP Quality Issue data structure Free any memory allocated for this data structure and its contents. This function will also call qiap_affected_product_delete() for each QIAP Affected Product that was set.

Parameters
quality_issueQIAP Quality Issue data structure that should be removed.

void qiap_set_error ( int  err,
const char *  message,
  ... 
)

Set the error value and optionally set a custom error message. If message is NULL then the default error message for the error number will be used.

Parameters
errValue of qiap_errno.
messageOptional error message using printf() format.

Variable Documentation

int qiap_errno

Variable that contains the error type. If no error has occurred the variable contains QIAP_SUCCESS (0).
